resources.string: A simple habit & goal tracker with notes, daily check-ins, progress ratings, a calendar view, and optional AI chizzuk for motivation.

What is WorkOnIt?
 WorkOnIt helps you build (or break) habits with the least friction: add a goal, jot quick notes, mark today as done, rate your day, and—when you need it—get a short boost of AI chizzuk.


How to use it (quick start):
 • Add a goal: tap the + on the main screen → give it a name → choose Type:
 • Positive = do this (e.g., “learn 15 min”).
 • Negative = avoid this (e.g., “no late scrolling”).
 • Set “times/week” as a target (optional) and save.
 • Goal details:
 • Notes: write anything you want to remember or reflect on.
 • Did you achieve today? tick the checkbox when you’ve done/avoided it.
 • Get Chizzuk 💪: tap to generate a short, warm encouragement (notes help tailor it).
 • Rate Progress: slide Difficulty, Motivation, and Success (0–10) for today.
 • Calendar:
 • View past days and see saved ratings for any date.
 • Tap “Rate this day” to log a rating for a specific date.


Tips:
 • Keep goal names short and specific (e.g., “walk 10 min”).
 • Use Notes to capture patterns or triggers.
 • “Times/week” is a guide—no hard enforcement—so be honest and kind to yourself.


Data & privacy:
 • Your notes, checkboxes, and ratings are stored locally on your device (SharedPreferences).
 • AI chizzuk is generated online; an internet connection is required when you tap it.


Credits:
 Built for the Android term project—multiple activities, toolbar menus, state restore, and a clean UI for everyday use.
